title: 5 people were hurt and cabins were 'torn open and crushed' after a cruise ship crashed into a cargo ship
text:
Five passengers from the German river-cruise ship Prinzessin Isabella were injured on October 8 after a collision with a cargo ship, according to the website Vessel Tracker.

Two of those passengers were reportedly taken to the hospital.

The Prinzessin Isabella, which was carrying 165 passengers, received significant damage, as multiple cabins on its upper passenger deck were "torn open and crushed," according to Vessel Tracker.

A video appearing to show the aftermath of the incident was posted on YouTube.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Five passengers from the German river-cruise ship Prinzessin Isabella were injured on October 8 after a collision with a cargo ship, according to the website Vessel Tracker.

Two of those passengers were reportedly taken to the hospital. The collision occured on the Danube River between Romania and Ukraine, according to Vessel Tracker. The cargo ship, named Blue Star 1, had reportedly been traveling from Piraeus, Greece, to Galati, Romania.

Read more: Cruise ship workers reveal the 7 most annoying things you can do as a passenger

The Prinzessin Isabella, which was carrying 165 passengers, received significant damage, as multiple cabins on its upper passenger deck were "torn open and crushed," according to Vessel Tracker. A video appearing to show the aftermath of the incident was posted on YouTube.

Romania's police force is investigating the incident, according to Vessel Tracker.

See also: Apply here to attend IGNITION: Transportation, an event focused on the future of transportation, in San Francisco on October 22

The German tour company Phoenix Reisen, which owns the Prinzessin Isabella, and the Romanian police did not immediately respond to Business Insider's requests for comment.

Have you worked on a cruise ship? Do you have a story to share? Email this reporter at mmatousek@businessinsider.com.
description: The German river-cruise ship Prinzessin Isabella crashed into a cargo ship on October 8, according to the website Vessel Tracker.
